intro: Clidemia pustulata, commonly known as the hairy beggar's-ticks, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of the Americas. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes many species of shrubs and vines. The plant is characterized by its opposite, ovate leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its small, white flowers are clustered in dense inflorescences, and it produces small, round fruits that contain multiple seeds. Clidemia pustulata is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
